```
$ type for
for is a shell keyword

```

```
# for u in bob joe ; do
useradd $u
echo '$u:Password1' | chpasswd
passwd -e $u
done
```

```
for f in * ; do
stat "$f"
done
```

```
$ for user in $(who | cut -f1 -d"") ; do
lsof -u $user -a -c bash | grep cwd
done

```

```
#!/bin/bash
echo "You are using $(basename $0)"
for n in $*
do
    echo "Hello $n"
done
exit 0
```

```
$ for f in * ; do
[ -d "$f" ] || continue
chmod 3777 "$f"
done

```

```
$ for f in * ; do
[ -d "$f" ] &&break
done
echo "We have found a directory $f"

```

```
for f in * ; do
[ -d "$f" ] || continue
dir_name="$dir_name $f"
done
echo "$dir_name"

```

```
$ COUNT=10
$ while (( COUNT >= 0 )) ; do
echo -e "$COUNT \c"
(( COUNT-- ))
done ; echo

```

```
$ COUNT=10
$ until (( COUNT < 0 )) ; do
echo -e "$COUNT \c"
(( COUNT-- ))
done ; echo

```

```
$ while read server ; do
ping -c1 $server && servers_up="$servers_up $server"
done < servers.txt
echo "The following servers are up: $servers_up"

```

```
#!/bin/bash
# Author: @theurbanpenguin
# Web: www.theurbapenguin.com
# Script to ping servers from file
# Last Edited: August 2015
if [ ! -f"$1 ] ; then
  echo "The input to $0 should be a filename"
  exit 1
fi
echo "The following servers are up on $(date +%x)"> server.out
done
while read server
do
  ping -c1 "$server"&& echo "Server up: $server">> server.out
done
cat server.out
```

```
#!/bin/bash
# Author: @theurbanpenguin
# Web: www.theurbapenguin.com
# Sample menu
# Last Edited: August 2015

while true
do
  clear
  echo "Choose an item: a,b or c"
  echo "a: Backup"
  echo "b: Display Calendar"
  echo "c: Exit"
  read -sn1
  read -n1 -p "Press any key to continue"
done
```
